reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel overnight, for no more than 12 hours. The hotel building is visible as soon as you get out of the Hakata Station, from where a short walk under a canopy takes you to the front door.
reviews.title: Great location, but ...

reviews.text: The location is superb for someone like me who needed to spend a night in Hakata before departing the next day. Cabs were readily available just outside the hotel to take me to the Fukuoka Airport, at roughly 15USD -- sturdier people can easily take the subway instead.
reviews.title: convenient and inexpensive

reviews.text: My Japanese acquaintances told me that Hakata is a shopper's paradise, and the train station itself is a eater's delight - none of which I had time to savor.
reviews.title: Perfect location with free breakfast + welcome drink

reviews.text: However, the hotel seems to be in need of some renovation. The Comfort Inns in the U.S. are not posh either, but this one has a motel-6 feel to it. I took a two-bed room, and the furnishing is strictly no-frills. But the wifi Internet connection works well, and the beds are comfortable. However, as I left the hotel, the door to a utility room next to the elevator was left open, and I caught sight of a shockingly shoddy floor with peeling vinyl coverings. It made me wonder about the upkeep of the hotel in general. I was glad to be leaving at that point.
reviews.title: SMART CHOICE

reviews.text: very convenient hotel across from Hakata train station and bus terminal. nice free breakfast and in-room Internet. This was my 4th time at this hotel but the 1st time which my room had these small black bugs especially in bathroom which I reported to front desk staff.
reviews.title: Comfort Hotel Hakata
